p: Nonetheless, it is well-established that oxidative stress contributes to the development of hypertension through nitric oxide (NO) deficiency [ 5, 6]. The vascular endothelial cells' product NO is a potent vasodilator with important roles in the growth and resistance of blood vessels [ 7, 8]. NO synthase inhibitors induce endothelial dysfunction and oxidative stress by decreasing NO activity. Subchronic administration of laboratory rodents with NO synthase inhibitors, such as N-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester (L-NAME), results in chronic hypertension [ 9, 10], hence the common use of this chemical for developing hypertension experimental models.
